Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of Point Nemo by stating that it is likely the closest humans to it are aboard the International Space Station. While it is true that the International Space Station is relatively close to Point Nemo compared to inhabited landmasses, the claim exaggerates the uniqueness of this situation.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient supporting evidence to prove that the closest humans to Point Nemo are aboard the International Space Station. It does not provide any specific data or sources to back up this assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the closest humans to Point Nemo are aboard the International Space Station without considering other possibilities. It does not explore alternative scenarios or provide any reasoning for why the International Space Station would be the closest human presence to this location.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the presence of humans near Point Nemo. It does not acknowledge the possibility of other remote research stations or expeditions in the area that could have human presence closer to Point Nemo than the International Space Station.
